Docs.summary: Represents a container that holds the contents of a templated menu item in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemTemplateContainer> class is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control as a container for the contents of the menu items that are rendered using a custom template.
> [!NOTE] > This class is used by control developers primarily when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class to create a container for a templated menu item.
You can define a custom template for the dynamic and static menu items of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicItemTemplate%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticItemTemplate%2A> properties, respectively.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemTemplateContainer> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemTemplateContainer> constructor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemTemplateContainer> class using the specified menu item index and menu item.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemTemplateContainer> class.

## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemTemplateContainer.DataItem%2A> property to specify or determine the menu item associated with the container.
> [!NOTE] > This property is used primarily by control developers when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class.
